comments:
On Package Explorer or the Navigator view, the right-click seems not to work anymore. 
It shows just a handful of options to the file, be it html, .java, .txt or whatever: "New >", 
"Copy" (disabled), "Paste" (disabled), "Import", "Export", "Refresh". I've tried to use an 
older build and it failed too. Tried to create a new workspace from scratch and it also 
didn't work. 
 
I am using some plugins with eclipse, like the solar eclipse plugin and the tomcat plugin. 
J2SDK 1.4.1_01. GTK+ 2.1.2 and GLIB 2.1.4. Right now it's eclipse M4 I am using. If I 
should give further data, please let me know.

Created an attachment (id=2872)
Screenshot of the problem

Screenshot of the problem

About the screenshot: Please note that, even though the 'ListaCarteiras.java' file is 
open on the editor, there is no difference between it being open or not: this happens 
with all files, and there's no way to open a file which is not already on the editor window 
short of creating it.
Is there anything in the .log file in the .metadata directory of your workspace?

Well, I tried to move .log to .log.old, touch a new .log and start eclipse to
see if there was something there. The log file kept at 0 bytes all the time. The
last entries are december 26, and I don't know if they are related. The last
records were:

If you wish, I could attach the entire log file.

Even on a clean installation, this bug appears. I installed a new clean eclipse
(20030107 integration build) on a new directory, built a new project, made a new
hell-world class and the bug is still here: the right-click pulldown menu is not
what it should be.

but this time I called eclipse thru eclipse& and noticed the following messages:

There is no stacktrace, tough. How can I debug it further?

It may be of note that I am using a rather recent distribution, with XFree86
4.2.1, glibc 2.2.5 and fontconfig 2.1. I don't know whether it can affect
eclipse, though.

I think that this last .log was not about this bug at all. I was trying to
create a launch configuration - which seems not to work well, but it is another
bug. So I removed the .log file, called eclipse again and just tried to
right-click the .java file I created. Then I left eclipse. This time no .log
file was created, and no error messages java.lang.NullPointerException were output.

Hint: I think this bug has mostly to do with some very recent library. I use a
'development' release of my distribution - Conectiva - and I update my rpms
almost every day. This began to happen in two installations of it, but only
these:other distributions did not show the same behaviour.

Nevertheless, I think it must be rather important to fix it, because if there's
a new library which has incompatibilities, it will soon begin to show up in
every distribution when they update packages.

It sounds most likely that the distribution you are using has a bug. Moving to 
SWT to comment on whether there may be an incompatibility that needs to be 
addressed.

How dumb of me: I should have done this before, I downloaded the motif build to
see if it was something about incompatibilities with my libraries. Well, the
motif build worked ok, the correct pulldown menus showed up. So it must has
something to do (I guess) with glib or gtk+2. My current versions are 2.2.5 and
2.1.2.

As I used the motif version and it worked, I can state with a good probability
of success that the problem really is in my distribution's packages. So I
reported this bug there too: http://bugzilla.conectiva.com.br/show_bug.cgi?id=7401

Ok, I not able to reproduce this on RedHat 8.0 and Gtk 2.2.0.
